Note: No specific chemical entities were mentioned in relation to Fanconi syndrome in the given paragraph. Fanconi syndrome is a medical condition characterized by the loss of specific substances in the urine, including glucose, amino acids, phosphate, and bicarbonate. It can be caused by various drugs, toxins, or underlying medical conditions. In this context, it is mentioned as a feature associated with an increased incidence of hospitalization for TDF kidney adverse effects.
